comments.body: nit: Would be nice to have an empty line before `package`.
Interesting. Would like to discuss this more. Feel free to direct me to the right forum (i.e. probably not this PR).

I *think* this is just an oversight, either of flit or the metadata 1.2 spec. PR with a fix is here: https://github.com/takluyver/flit/pull/99

[metadata 2.0](https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0426/) adds a spec for putting license files in wheels, but [metadata 1.2](https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0345/), which flit implements, doesn't, only putting a reference to the license (if standard) or its content (if not) in the metadata.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +35,39 @@  license_family: MIT
  # FIXME: flit wheels don't include license file, only reference in metadata
  # license_file
  summary: Testpath is a collection of utilities for Python code working with files and commands.
